main.name: Roy Guo
main.occupation: Master of Engineering student at UC Berkeley, majoring in Computer Science
main.description: My goal is to learn through interactions with others and make contributions to the world through my work
main.bio: The main focuses of my work are 3D Graphics, Human-Computer Interaction, Game Development, and AR/VR Technologies. Previously I have worked at Microsoft and TuSimple as a software engineering intern for Summer 2017 and Fall 2017 respectively.

resume.skillmessage: My skills include most major programming languages, multi-platform app development and game development.

education.description: Researcher at Vive Center for Enhanced Reality at UC Berkeley. I am developing AR/VR solutions to various problems, such as autonomous driving.

I was a tutor at UCSD's Computer Science & Engineering Department, teaching data science, data structures, Python, and Java. I worked across different software projects, including games, web applications, and mobile applications.

work.company: A Graph-based Framework to Bridge Movies and Synopses
work.title: Oral Presentation at ICCV 2019
work.description: Constructed a dataset called Movie Synopses Associations (MSA) over 328 movies. Developed a framework to perform matching between movie segments and synopsis paragraphs. Using React and Flask, built and designed a cross-platform tool for movie-related labeling jobs. Using motion energy model, pre-processed raw movie data and movie info into segments and keyframes.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Developed a web tool for the truck movement simulation using ReactJS and Redux. Built a MongoDB database to store simulation results.

work.title: Machine Learning Intern
work.description: Developed on early stage of Suphx, the world's strongest Mahjong AI, whose stable rank is 17% higher than top human player's. Researched on reinforcement learning approaches, such as prior coaching, to optimize information-asymmetric games. Using Qt, built a game log visualizer to track the model's decision-making processes.

projects.title: Ironman
projects.category: VR solution for tele-operating RC car

projects.title: KillStreak
projects.category: OpenGL based Multiplayer Online Battle Arena

projects.title: A Happy Ending
projects.category: Virtual Reality First Person Horror Game. The winner of "Most Polished Game" and "Best Sound Effects" awards in the all-campus VR game competition

testimonials.text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
